body_html:
@byronyi

The output for command ulimit -l is unlimited, and I have installed nv_peer_mem according to the guide in Mellanox/nv_peer_memory. Here is the output for command /etc/init.d/nv_peer_mem status : nv_peer_mem module is loaded.
body_text:
@byronyi
The output for command ulimit -l is unlimited, and I have installed nv_peer_mem according to the guide in Mellanox/nv_peer_memory. Here is the output for command  /etc/init.d/nv_peer_mem status : nv_peer_mem module is loaded.
body:
@byronyi 

The output for command ```ulimit -l``` is ```unlimited```, and I have installed ```nv_peer_mem``` according to the guide in [Mellanox/nv_peer_memory](https://github.com/Mellanox/nv_peer_memory). Here is the output for command ``` /etc/init.d/nv_peer_mem status``` : ```nv_peer_mem module is loaded.```
